alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Lee; Leslie; McCreary; Owsley; Perry; Pulaski; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Laurel, Knox, Owsley, northwestern Leslie, northwestern Perry, southeastern Pulaski, Jackson, McCreary, Whitley, southwestern Breathitt, southern Lee and Clay Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from New Zion to Pittsburg to near Blue Heron. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... London, McKee, Pittsburg, Earnestville, New Zion, Carmichael, East Bernstadt, Turkey Foot, Green Hall and Sublimity City around 730 PM EDT. Maplesville, Travellers Rest, Wild Dog, Delvinta, Sturgeon, Banford, Cressmont, Atlanta, Levi Jackson S.P. and Greenmount around 735 PM EDT. Vincent, Endee, Ida May, Mcwhorter, Caryton, Blake, Lesbas, Pine Knot and Island City around 740 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Scoville, Levi, Langnau, Deer Lick, Crawford, Pebworth, Major, Corgleton, Royrader, Booneville, Portersburg, Chestnut Gap, Turin, Stay, Southfork, Marydell, Fogertown, Lower Buffalo, Benge, Byron, Lerose, Eversole, Cowcreek, Grace, Grass, Hollyhill, Bush, Lake, Ricetown, Manchester, Urban, Hooker, Sidell, Zion Hill, Jetts Creek, Herron, Ayers, Sibert and Pigeonroost. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 37. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 1 and 49. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 3 and 26. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: ILN, LMK, we are continuing to monitor, but holding off for now. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Clay; Jackson; Knox; Laurel; Lee; Leslie; McCreary; Owsley; Perry; Pulaski; Whitley
